Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spencedanny1
Reviews.Content: The impala is suituated in the leidsplein district of amsterdam, 5 minutes walk from the bulldog coffeeshop, and about 15 minutes walk to dam square & red light district. I would recommened this hotel if your going for a mens or womans weekend away, its very basic but does the job well, we had a shower so powerfull it nearly threw you to the other side of the street, it was the best shower ive ever been in, fantastic I would go back again yes definately, ive actually stayed here about 3 times now on a lads weekend trip

Reviews.Title: “do NOT stay here! horrible place”
Reviews.Author: JamesD1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is smelly, the reception consists of cheap old plastic furniture. The stairs is covered by a carpet that is worn through so you can see the underlying staircase. Everything is dirty and smelly. Breakfast is included in the price, I skipped that one voluntarily, considering the standard of everything else in the hotel I definitely do not want to eat something there. I never saw any other guests there, my guess is that the people that book this hotel either immediately leave the hotel and go somewhere else (and hence have to pay for 2 hotels since you have to pay in advance for your room when you book it on the phone), or they do what I did: Pack all valuables in the knapsack and immediately leave the hotel and try to stay out as long as possible since you definitely want to spend as little time as possible in this hotel. It is obvious that the hotel room has been broken into several times, and the hotel owners have tried to prevent that it would happen again by attaching a metal frame. The metal frame is severely bent from the front side of the doors and it looks like there have been attempts to break in after the metal frame was there. The shower in the room was totally rotten and stinks, I never used it. The toilet is not in the room, its down the hallway, with a door that leaves a 8 cm gap if you try to close it and it STINKS from urine. I used the toilets at Burger King during daytime, rather than going into the hotel's disgusting toilet. This pillow was probably white once upon a time, I do not want to know where all the spots comes from, nor how many unidentified kinds of animals that lives in the pillow. The rest of the bed sheets were full of holes, but looked at least clean. The blankets and pillows were disgusting. I used my sleeping bag.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: dayna76
Reviews.Content: We went there a year ago and the only thing i can say is (do not stay there) The triple room was big but under my bed i found a chocolate of hundred years,the smell of the bathroom was terrible,the heating did not work (and after one night that we stayed in this room with no heat they moved us in another room).In this 'wonderful' room we show a mouse!!!!!! DO NOT GO

Reviews.Title: “the place for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: evalok
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nts, rate was 70 euros for a double however, we moved from our closet sized room to a triple next door when the bath drain clogged up. the triple was GREAT! about 3x the size of the double, i highly r recommend a triple, we had a small balcony and it was very bright with the big windows. breakfast was good, yes, stairs are very steep by typical. i'd recommend this place but caution that it's great for budget travellers. the triple was only 80 euro and plenty big. water pressure was good and the room was clean. i occasionally smelled cigarette smoke but it wasn't offensive or constant. do not get a double since they are tiny. staff was nice, especially the cleaning lady. oh and we had a problem with the door lock, it locked, we just had trouble getting in the room! good location.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book Hotel Impala - BELIEVE the reviews”
Reviews.Author: GirlsTrips2008
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Impala for me and three friends over easter weekend. The cheap rate and great location seemed perfect. THEN I saw the reviews.... and foolishly decided to ignore them as we knew we were staying in a cheap, in effect - backbacker's hotel and wasn't expecting the Ritz. We arrived at about 09:30... we had to ring the doorbell 5 times before anyone opened it.... who turned out to be a guest because there were NO staff in the building. After 10 minutes of waiting around like idiots, a man appeared from his room..... explained that he doesn't work there - but could tell us that they are fully booked and had accepted anyone that had been to the hotel asking for a room - regardless of previous bookings. He tried phoning round other hotels - which were all fully booked. EVERYTHING you read is true, the carpet is filthy etc etc. And as the guy who helped us out said.....''everyone wants to stay here because it's cheap, so they come, more come and now the [--] place is just falling apart'' I strongly reccomend 'The Owl Hotel' - we ended up staying here, and it was lovely - comapred to the squalor we would have been staying in!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've Ever Been!!!”
Reviews.Author: ceres79
Reviews.Content: Everything in this Hotel was extremely mucky: the floor cover, the key of the room didn't work, the windows were dirty and broken, the bed sheets had strange stains like the towels in the bathroom and the room walls!!! Moreover, when we had breakfast in the morning no one were there to help us and nothing was ready to be used: finally we had to clean dishes and cups!! The last day, when we had to pay, even the credit card machine didn't work (it was broken since the first day we arrived there)...hence my friendly suggestion is: DON'T GO TO IMPALA HOTEL!!! Now you are worned...

Reviews.Title: “dirty, rotten, filty rip off”
Reviews.Author: hectorpoo
Reviews.Content: after booking to stay in the king hotel we arrived to find they had doubled booked us but they told us not worry they had put us in a much better quality hotel for the inconvience. however when she took us round we were greated by friendly staff and two ankle bitting dogs. our room was not ready so we asked if we could wait as he only had to hoover it we were shown into this room which had a great big no smoking sign on the door yet we found our selves sitting next to a full ashtray. 1 hour later of sitting in this filthy dirty room which we can only describe as the lounge and breakfast area.watching cnn and thinking shall we offer to help hoover the room. in the end we asked what was going on with the room. we were placed on the third floor up the steepest stairs known to man. once we got in the room we found that we had a bed, tv, cabinet and 2 dining room chairs. so as we started to get settled we found the tv only one channel and that was in black and white and not tuned in, the tv cabinet had empty beercans, crisp packets and just pure filth in there. remember this is after he had been in room for an hour supposedly hoovering. after a hard days walking around amsterdam we were ready to chill and settle for the night. the shower had no curtain and as for the lights in bedroom we would of had more light from candles. how romantic. after laying on the bed watching our one channel in black and white, my husband moves everso slightly and i then turn round to find him practically on the floor as the bed had collasped. its a good thing he is good at diy as he had to dismantled and rebuild this bed. after a painful nights sleep we were woken to the smell of sewage coming from our leaky toilet. We didnt even attempt breakfast as we thought we might get dog hair in it. we left and got half our money back and booked into this fantastic 3 star hotel round the corner from the marriott for 89euros with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Understaffed, No breakfast tho paid for, Prepay cash only, No Refunds”
Reviews.Author: whidbeywanderer
Reviews.Content: Several rooms have nice views. Most do not. The small rooms were dark and dirty when we got there and stayed dirty during our stay. It is an old small dirty 1 star hotel with some potential to maybe be more. There were days without maid service because the maids had been fired for stealing. The rooms were not cleaned every day... The tub/shower in our bathroom had no curtain to keep the water in nor a drain on the floor.... so if anyone took a shower, you walked in stagnant deeply pooled water on the floor to use the bathroom or used your bath towels to dry and wring it. There were boards missing from the floor over filthy carpet. The furniture was falling apart. The bed collapsed when I raised the mattress to look under it!! It was gross. No phone. No elevator and very steep narrow flights of stairs... no bellboys so you carry your own luggage yourself. Breakfast was supposed to be included and was prepaid for, but there were times the food was not fresh, and non-exsistent!... It was gone when we got to breakfast althogh it was well within the posted breakfast hours! The manager insisted on prepayment and cash only- no credit cards, and kept wanting to raise the prices. He still charged us full amount and wouldn't refund money even when breakfast or maid service was not available.. and still wanted to charge us even more!!!! Beware of what you are getting into with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good secure accomadation”
Reviews.Author: realm
Reviews.Content: The hotel Impala is a good base for any party goer or sightseer to this beautiful city. I stayed in this hotel 3 times in the last 2 years. The hotel could do with a lick of paint and a better breakfast offering but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff by far make up for this. The best rooms in the hotel are the triple rooms, one of which even has a large bath. It is in a good location that is central to pubs clubs and the trams. If your looking for the Ritz then stay at the Ritz and pay their prices. The Impala is good value for money with great views and as most people travel here on a budget you could do much worse for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Friendly Informed Staff”
Reviews.Author: Martin F
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on this site we came to this hotel with some reservations, but we had a reservation and went. It is a fantastic location, the view from our room, which is at at T-junction of two canals, is fantastic. Open those windows and enjoy the sensory experience, the view, the sounds of the various boats and the people walking by. We tried not to look back into the room too much, the manager told us of the ways in which the cleaners use bleach to clean everything, including carpets. The staff were really friendly; they went out of their way to find information about trains, tours, night events etc. I enjoyed my conversations over the generous breakfast. Just round the corner you can hire a paddle boat. If you are feeling energetic enough it is a great way to see the canals without the commentary and crowds. Travelling with Australian dollars with home prices in mind everything seems expensive, but compared with other places we tried the Hotel Impala was great value. it is a really nice budget hotel and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reservations well before our trip. The first thing that happened when we arrived to check in to the Hotel Impala was that they charged each of us with an additional 20 Euros. They claimed that was something all hotels do but we werenâ€™t told about that in advance. In addition, the room wasnâ€™t ready. They did let us leave our luggage until it was ready. When we got into our room, the handle for the hot water on the sink came off. They gave us a pliers to use and said the plumber would be there by 5:00. He never came. The day we were leaving, we packed our luggage so that it would be ready at check out time, then we went out for an hour or so. When we returned to our room, our pass keys didnâ€™t work. It was not past checkout time, and we hadnâ€™t checked out yet, but they turned off our cards. The staff was courteous all the time, but they made no attempt to make up for all the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice + clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Impala for two nights to finish two months back-packing through Europe. It is a nice, clean hotel and our room had a great view of the canal. The bathroom was huge, which was a pleasant change from other budget hotels in Europe and the TV had lots of English stations. Breakfast was really nice too, definately worth waking up for. The only negatives about our stay were some furnishings in our room were a bit out-dated and the stairs to the 3rd floor were a health hazard they're that steep! The staff are extremely helpful though and they gave us some great tips for seeing the best of Amsterdam. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All about the view !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a couple aged 42 and 46 who know how to enjoy ourselves and are up for most things. Amsterdam is one of our favourite places in the world. We like to travel on a budget but don't put up with crap just to get the cheapest price. We stayed at the Hotel Impala for the 4th night of our 4 night stay. We're not generally fussy but this was the 4th different room in 3 different Hotels. The first was disgustingly dirty with 'surprises' under the bed, the second was ok but after one night they moved us to a room with a waterbed which was deflated and didn't help with a nights sleep despite an extra dose of Super Silver Haze to get us off ? Then we came accross the Hotel Impala. The first thing that struck us was the friendliness of the staff, yes I know all the Dutch seem to be friendly but these were particularly nice. The Hotel was clean enough and, after we had climbed the 2 flights of narrow stairs to our 4 bedded room (it was all they had available for the two of us), we were pleasantly surprised. The carpets on the way up and in some of the other rooms left a lot to be desired but they seemed clean. Our room, however, had a laminate flloor, a reasonably comfortable bed, a very nice clean bathroom and a stunning view. The walls could do with a coat of paint, there is a balcony with 2 big opening doors that you can't walk out of because it's not safe, an old fireplace which could be lovely, nowhere to hang your clothes or make a cup of tea but a window that fully opens up to leave what must be one of the best Canal views in Amsterdam. After a hard days exploring it was lovely to get back to the room, open up the windows and sit having a drink and a smoke whilst watching the world go by. Then, when we got in after a night out we'd open up the windows and enjoy the serenity. If you're travelling on a budget, you don't expect luxury and can put up without being able to hang your clothes up then this could be the place for you. Even the American Hotel, 100m down the road hasn't got a view like this one which is Worth the stay on it's own. We'll be going back and asking for the same room !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Islandlynn
Reviews.Content: Easy going and friendly, the young staff is always pleasant and enjoys working in this great find. You know its good because its booked full of young 20-30 something friends and couples from all over the globe every weekend. It's a two star- so don't expect four poster beds and made to order omlettes. But the breakfast room is nice and spacious, and great for making a cup of tea while watching some late night TV. It feels like home, excellent location in the Leidseplein area- tucked away location on a nice canal means no neon signs in sight. My triple had a great canal view to watch the boats and even a sitting area in a window nook. The doubles can be much smaller. Can't recommend it enough, especially for the very reasonable prices and a casual and friendly stay with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Stay in a very confortable hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: daintym
Reviews.Content: I was impressed witht the friendliness and cleaness this hotel has.Very recomanded, Breakfast was far way over what i tought we get, we had freshly baked bread with a choice of cheeses and cereals.Excellent!Ive been to amsterdam a number of times and wasnt lucky on hotels as this time.I will Definetly go there again .

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Impala
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekade 77, Amsterdam 1017 PM, The Netherlands
